alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 5:42PM MST until July 15 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Burn Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 542 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Doney Park, Little Elden Spring Horse Camp and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 428. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
